sub_topic: Determining the length of a diagonal in a rectangular prism.
message_1: A rectangular prism has a length of 10 cm, width of 6 cm and height of 8 cm. Find the length of its diagonal.
message_2:
To find the length of the diagonal of a rectangular prism, we can use the 3D Pythagorean theorem. The formula is:

Diagonal length = √(length² + width² + height²)

Given the dimensions of the rectangular prism are length = 10 cm, width = 6 cm, and height = 8 cm, we can plug these values into the formula:

Diagonal length = √(10² + 6² + 8²)
Diagonal length = √(100 + 36 + 64)
Diagonal length = √(200)

The length of the diagonal of the rectangular prism is √(200) cm, which is approximately 14.14 cm.
